description: What a great piece of software
And why would a personal finance app require an email login?
Not a good option for someone looking for a simple invoicing program

Here is the output i got:

(invoiceninja:156265): Gtk-WARNING **: 19:23:24.536: Theme parsing error: gtk.css:1374:85: 'font-feature-settings' is not a valid property name

(invoiceninja:156265): Gdk-ERROR **: 19:23:24.652: The program 'invoiceninja' received an X Window System error.
This probably reflects a bug in the program.
The error was 'BadAlloc'.
 (Details: serial 277 error_code 11 request_code 149 (unknown) minor_code 2)
 (Note to programmers: normally, X errors are reported asynchronously;
  that is, you will receive the error a while after causing it.
  To debug your program, run it with the GDK_SYNCHRONIZE environment
  variable to change this behavior. You can then get a meaningful
  backtrace from your debugger if you break on the gdk_x_error() function.)
Trace/breakpoint trap (core dumped)

Ich nutze LinuxMint 21.1 und die App vergisst sämtliche Zugangsdaten. Bei jedem Start muss ich auch die URL eintippen. Ich gehe direkt über die Webapp und merke auch keinen Geschwindigkeitsunterschied. Nutze den Turnkey lxc unter Proxmox.
